meanings.definition: To remove from a mounting or support.
meanings.sent1: I will demount the picture from the wall.
meanings.sent2: Please demount the TV from the stand carefully.
meanings.sent3: The demounted painting surprised everyone in the room.
meanings.sent4: Her smile demounted the walls around his heart.
meanings.sent5: The magician demounted the birdcage in a flash of light.

meanings.sent1: He will demount the old bicycle for spare parts.
meanings.sent2: It is important to demount the furniture before moving.
meanings.sent3: The robot demounted itself and scattered its pieces around the room.
meanings.sent4: The team had to demount their project and start from scratch.
meanings.sent5: She carefully demounted the clock, revealing its intricate gears.

meanings.sent1: The astronaut will demount from the spacecraft for a spacewalk.
meanings.sent2: You should demount the phone from its charger when fully charged.
meanings.sent3: The demounted balloon floated away into the sky.
meanings.sent4: His words demounted any doubts she had about their friendship.
meanings.sent5: The key demounted easily from the keychain.
